rule.description: Recovering 0 is not an act of recovering.

Infernal Vessel's effect doesn't modify recover costs or prevent recover costs from being paid. E.g. If a cost requires a payment of recover 5, your champion must have five damage counters on them in order to pay for this cost, but only two damage counters are removed as result of paying that cost.

rule.description: The first ability only triggers for the first instance of a Chessman entering each turn and will consider this retroactively. If a Chessmen ally already entered before Field of Rank and Files enters, it can no longer trigger in the same turn.

The second ability only triggers for the first instance of a Chessmen Command card activation and will consider this retroactively in the same manner as the first ability. It will not apply to a second Chessmen Command card if the first did not enter the intent.

rule.description: Lurking Assailant's [Level 1+] ability allows it to retaliate against attackers even if that attacker isn't attacking Lurking Assailant. For example, if the opponent is attacking your champion with an ally, Lurking Assailant can retaliate. During that damage step, your champion will take damage from the attacking ally, and Lurking Assailant will deal damage to that attacking ally.

On Enter: Draw a card into your memory.

Each player's maximum influence is seven. (As each player's end phase resolves, that player discards cards from their hand and/or memory until their influence is equal to their maximum influence.)

rule.description: If a player’s influence exceeds seven during the resolution of their end phase, they must choose and discard cards from across their hand and/or until their influence becomes seven. Players may only discard cards to meet the requirement and can’t discard more than the required amount.
